abstract: DealBook live-blogged the Berkshire Hathaway annual shareholder meeting, where Warren E. Buffett criticized actions by his former lieutenant, David Sokol as “inexcusable and inexplicable.”
snippet: DealBook live-blogged the Berkshire Hathaway annual shareholder meeting, where Warren E. Buffett criticized actions by his former lieutenant, David Sokol as “inexcusable and inexplicable.”
lead_paragraph: OMAHA — It is time once again for Berkshire Hathaway’s annual shareholder meeting, the two-day frenzy of Warren E. Buffett aficionados who have descended here to listen to his latest musings. This meeting promises to be even more interesting than ever, given the controversy over David L. Sokol, whose recent resignation cast a pall over the normally jovial proceedings.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Warren E. Buffett called David L. Sokol’s actions “inexplicable and inexcusable” during Berkshire Hathaway’s annual shareholders meeting in Omaha.
snippet: Warren E. Buffett called David L. Sokol’s actions “inexplicable and inexcusable” during Berkshire Hathaway’s annual shareholders meeting in Omaha.
lead_paragraph: OMAHA — The billionaire Warren E. Buffett offered on Saturday his sharpest criticism yet of a former top lieutenant at his investment company, Berkshire Hathaway, saying that David L. Sokol had violated company trading policy and calling Mr. Sokol’s actions “inexplicable and inexcusable.”

headline.main: Buffett Takes Sharper Tone on Sokol’s Actions

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Shortly after Warren E. Buffett criticized David L. Sokol for violating company policy, the former Berkshire Hathaway executive again fought back and argued that he did nothing wrong.
snippet: Shortly after Warren E. Buffett criticized David L. Sokol for violating company policy, the former Berkshire Hathaway executive again fought back and argued that he did nothing wrong.
lead_paragraph: OMAHA — Saturday was the first time Warren E. Buffett had spoken publicly at length about David L. Sokol, criticizing his former lieutenant for violating Berkshire Hathaway‘s policies about trading.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: As the serious business of explaining Berkshire Hathaway's strategy and policies gets underway in Omaha, thousands of people gather to celebrate the mystique of legendary investor Warren E. Buffett.
snippet: As the serious business of explaining Berkshire Hathaway's strategy and policies gets underway in Omaha, thousands of people gather to celebrate the mystique of legendary investor Warren E. Buffett.
lead_paragraph: As the serious business of explaining Berkshire Hathaway's strategy and policies gets underway in Omaha, thousands of people gather to celebrate the mystique of legendary investor Warren E. Buffett.
